page.title: 06EMPLOYMENT IN POTT SHRIGLEY
page.content: Although the area is a rural one there are three pockets of small industrial units, one being a former cotton mill, one a disused brickworks, the other a disused quarry. The mill has small engineering units, a Christmas cracker maker and other small enterprises. The quarry has a paving flag maker and the brickworks welding & small engineering There is a working quarry selling stone. There are also heavy haulage firms, which are causing some concern with large lorries using narrow lanes. Unemployment is low in comparison to other areas of the U.K., the majority being employed in nearby Bollington and Macclesfield and some commuting to the Manchester area. The sheep and dairy farms are family units and employ little extra labour. Public houses and a cafe pravide a small amount of part time employment.
